blocks.value: St. Joseph was the husband of the Blessed Virgin Mary and the foster father of Jesus Christ. He was a descendant of King David and worked as a carpenter in Nazareth. The Gospels describe Joseph as a "righteous man" (Matthew 1:19).

When Mary was found to be with child through the Holy Spirit, Joseph planned to quietly divorce her to protect her from shame. However, an angel appeared to him in a dream and revealed that the child was conceived by the Holy Spirit and that Joseph should take Mary as his wife. Joseph obeyed without question. He protected and provided for the Holy Family, taking them to Egypt to escape Herod's massacre of the innocents.

St. Joseph is honored as the Patron and Protector of the Universal Church. He is also the patron of workers, fathers, families, and a happy death (since tradition holds that he died in the arms of Jesus and Mary). Though little is recorded about Joseph in Scripture, his faithful obedience and loving protection of Jesus and Mary make him one of the greatest saints. Pope Francis has a special devotion to St. Joseph and declared a Year of St. Joseph in 2021.
Feastday March 19th (St. Joseph, Husband of Mary) and May 1st (St. Joseph the Worker).
